summary: The Cure Hepatitis C Act of 2025 aims to eliminate hepatitis C virus in the United States. It establishes a Hepatitis C Elimination Program within the Department of Health and Human Services, including a national strategy, advisory committee, and interagency working group. The bill creates a subscription program to provide hepatitis C treatments to specific populations, including those on Medicaid, in correctional facilities, and without minimum essential coverage. It also increases access to treatments within the Medicare program and provides funding for public health activities like screening, treatment, and provider training.
